name: commercially
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to the buying and selling of goods and services in order to make a profit: Does the market research show that the product will succeed commercially? The drug won't be commercially available until it has been thoroughly tested. Carrying one person into orbit is probably not commercially viable. See
commercial
More examplesFewer examplesThe family has grown roses commercially since 1949.The majority of commercially broadcast content is formatted for 4:3 screens.Warfarin, which grew out of research in the 1930s by scientists at the University of Wisconsin, was first used commercially as a rat poison.

Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is related to making money: The movie was a great success commercially. Managers need to be encouraged to think more commercially.
in order to be sold: make/manufacture/produce sth commercially No-one is yet manufacturing the product commercially. Right now, corn is the primary ingredient for commercially available biofuels.
